data.text:
I get mocked for this, but I still believe that love will bring the end to war.

Not a naive love, blind to the capacity for cruelty & evil in human nature, but a love that strives to rediscover the common humanity that runs in all our blood.
"Stay hungry. Stay foolish." - Steve Jobs
@elonmusk @nbcsnl Thanks Wario. You're not evil, just misunderstood.
Power naps are magic.

In May 1973, the Internet had 42 computers (squares) and 36 nodes (ovals). Today, it's billions.

Imagine what technology today is at the stage where the Internet was in 1973, and where it will be in 50 years. https://t.co/1pHvHLGazG

Here's my conversation with John Danaher, one of the most fascinating minds in the history of martial arts. We talk about jiu jitsu, grappling, judo, MMA & what it takes to engineer the mind of a robot that defeats the best grapplers in the world. https://t.co/XBB7wYhThF https://t.co/QZGt8ifL4w
Doge responsibly.
New case for my PC looks like it knows how to have fun. https://t.co/FxJ3hRvepB

The brain uses 10 watts of power to do up to 20 quadrillion "calculations" (synaptic firings), 1 million times more than a modern computer.

10 watts is about 300 kcal/day. So the human computer requires 3 bananas worth of power to operate.

PS: These are all quick estimates.

In 1905, Einstein published 4 papers, each enough to revolutionize science:

1. Light is a particle (Nobel prize)
2. Brownian motion
3. Special relativity: speed of light is fixed
4. Energy and matter are same: e=mc^2

One person can change the world. This gives me hope.

Two orbiting black holes create gravitational waves, which are ripples is spacetime itself. Imagine riding those waves!

They are tiny by the time they reach Earth but we can still measure them with the world's most precise ruler (LIGO).

Physics & engineering are beautiful. https://t.co/NEQGxGFiIf
During an average lifetime, the heart beats 2.5 billion times.
@elonmusk Aliens on Mars.
@elonmusk James Bond: License to Cancel
The cryptocurrency world is a high-stakes battle of ideas.

Here's my conversation with @SergeyNazarov, CEO of @chainlink, about smart contracts, oracle networks, and the future of data-driven human interactions in the digital world. https://t.co/1HyTpcoom4 https://t.co/2UFrTexH5Q
A human jumping on Earth (1g), Mars (0.38g), and the Moon (0.17g). https://t.co/6MDXfi9fUB
Here's my conversation with @JeremiSuri, a historian at UT Austin. We talk about American history through the lens of individuals who wielded power. https://t.co/Ox1fPWRlbM https://t.co/k4DpWKjT0a
@elonmusk Driving is a real-world Turing Test.
I love Texas.

In WWII, more civilians died than military personal. 2x more. 50+ million.

Most of those stories of suffering, and of love, will never be told.

But in a way, they remain in the collective memory of our species, fueling our hope-filled, interminable drive to reach for the stars.

Prisoners of Nazi concentration camps wrote over 8,000 pieces of music, including symphonies, operas, and folk songs scribbled on food wrappings, telegrams, potato sacks.

Music is hope: amid the ugliness in the world, we humans always find a wellspring of beauty.

Tesla is becoming an AI company.

It's exciting to watch.

I still believe that the human sensing and human-robot interaction piece is one of the most important and currently has not gotten much attention.

I will try to help in my small way.
@elonmusk Starship: number go up.

Men in black: a podcast. 
https://t.co/qtnuktPkoY https://t.co/SFn5nouUlC

Here's my conversation with @GeorgesStPierre, considered by many to be the greatest fighters in the history of MMA and one of the greatest martial artists ever. Meeting Georges & spending the day with him was an honor beyond words. https://t.co/qtnuku6Vgw https://t.co/TytqEx4j2S
"Think lightly of yourself and deeply of the world." - Miyamoto Musashi
@elonmusk The most entertaining outcome is the most likely.

Here's my conversation with @michaelmalice and @yaronbrook. An anarchist, an objectivist, and a robot walk into a bar... This was one of the most fun, intense, and interesting conversations I've ever been a part of. I loved it. https://t.co/jGfbyEpDCn https://t.co/ug3T9nAOLp
RT @elonmusk: @lexfridman Yup
Humans have been gradually merging with AI for 20+ years. At some point in this century, as a collective intelligence system, we will become more AI than human, and we won't notice.
@elonmusk Aka evolution-driven distributed neural network supercomputer.

.@ApplePodcasts recently upgraded its platform. And now, for some reason, many episodes of my podcast are missing there.

Again, this is hopefully a bug, but it's also a reminder that platforms have power.

Podcasting is freedom. @Apple should empower this freedom, not limit it.
Life is beautiful. I'm the luckiest guy in the world. I love you all.
RT @kennyflorian: The conversation on #bitcoin money, freedom etc between @lexfridman and @Breedlove22 was a thing of beauty! 👏🙏

Me: I love Austin so I'm moving there.
@TimJDillon: I hate Austin so I'm moving there.

Tim is becoming a villain in a real-life superhero movie.

We're having dinner today. If you never hear from me again, you know why.

PS: Follow Tim's slow decline into madness on his Patreon.

Total living biomass on Earth is 550 billion metric tons. Humans account for 0.01% of that.

There are 10^21 living organisms for every 1 human. Earth is teeming with life.

PS: 90% of life by biomass is on land, only 10% in the ocean.

A sperm cell has 760 megabytes of DNA data.

Sex then is a data transfer of 200,000 terabytes.

PS:
- the data is highly redundant & compressible
- most of the data will be discarded
- actual data transfer takes up to several days
- this is a fun estimate, not a hardware spec
Correction: $0.69 for Dogecoin on 4/20 is indeed the more entertaining outcome.

@ajtourville 1. gravity
2. electromagnetism
3. weak nuclear force
4. strong nuclear force
5. fun

So it looks like 4/20 is now Doge Day, a time to celebrate the power of the meme.

If Dogecoin hits $1 on 4/20, it's proof that the universe tends toward the most entertaining outcome.

"The line separating good and evil passes through every human heart. And even within hearts overwhelmed by evil, one small bridgehead of good is retained. And even in the best of all hearts, there remains a small corner of evil." - Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn, The Gulag Archipelago

Here's my conversation with Risto Miikkulainen about neuroevolution and evolutionary computation. Evolutionary algorithms are fascinating in that they regularly exhibit creativity and find solutions that are  truly surprising (and sometimes hilarious). https://t.co/Qv0EoeuSwx https://t.co/NwsrjIkL5I

Life is short when you're having fun, and long when you're not.

General Relativity describes how mass bends spacetime. 

I propose an extension to GR: fun bends spacetime too.

Perhaps rocket propulsion systems of the future will create a wormhole in spacetime via the Fun Field.
RT @Breedlove22: Thanks for having me @lexfridman—I appreciate your willingness to explore #Bitcoin and its many tangential topics with cur…

Here's my conversation with Robert Breedlove (@Breedlove22). We talk for 4 hours about Bitcoin, from first principles, in the context of money, freedom, time, and power. https://t.co/zS0rP4gP1u https://t.co/HiusOoXHoI
Sharks were on Earth before trees. 400 million years vs 350 million years.

@elonmusk Yes. 3 awesome things so far:
1. Brisket
2. Music scene is wild
3. People are genuinely nice

.@YouTube took down my conversion with @joerogan from a few months ago (episode #127 on my podcast).

I'm guessing it's an automated system bug and they'll fix it. But still, it's a good reminder that platforms have power.
@elonmusk Greatest adventure of the 21st century.
RT @elonmusk: @lexfridman One of many reasons that we need to make life multiplanetary!

252 million years ago, nearly all life on Earth came to an end. The Permian-Triassic extinction, aka The Great Dying, killed 90% of species on Earth. Cause is unknown. Theories include volcanoes and meteors.

We're lucky.
Reservoir Doge. Thank you Internet. https://t.co/TpZJwynUni

Recent podcast episodes I really enjoyed:
- @SamHarrisOrg on free will
- @joerogan on physics & wrestling
- @TimJDillon on life
- @JackRhysider on security & human hacking
- @APompliano on bitcoin & business
- @hubermanlab on emotion
- @GustavS on music & piracy

Check them out!
In 1800, 43% of people died before the age of 5. Today, it's 4%.

Apparently, there's a bunch of fake accounts with the name "Lex Fridman" on various platforms. In fact, I'm pretty sure I'm not real either.

The important thing: If someone named Lex writes to you, please be careful and don't click random links.
RT @yannispappas: Seriously one of the best if not best conversation I have ever had in my life. This was epic and I Love Lex. Thanks for h…

Here's my conversation with Yannis Pappas (@yannispappas) about history, comedy & how @TimJDillon cannot be trusted with absolute power. This was fun. PS: There'll be more technical episodes on AI, math, physics & science coming up. See intro for details. https://t.co/ecBTVAfhCn https://t.co/wjg1WoEGGh
Bitcoin is serious. Dogecoin is fun. Life needs a bit of both.

Hitler, Stalin, and Freud all lived in Vienna in 1913.

It's fascinating to think how much of human history could've turned on chance encounters.

Here's my conversation with @tylercowen about economic growth, resisting conformity, the value of being weird, competition and capitalism, UFO sightings, contemporary art, best food in the world, and of course, love, death, and meaning. https://t.co/RGN1n7IbTZ https://t.co/lAqO1cViGr
@elonmusk 👀

I suspect that a significant % of division and misinformation online is initiated and fueled by bots. Cybersecurity systems then have to defend not only our computers but our minds against digital mind viruses.
@elonmusk Leet monkey influencers
@elonmusk @neuralink Amazing. Early steps in the merger of human consciousness and artificial intelligence.

I have an ego. It helps me work harder, but mostly it results in me speaking from emotion, saying things I don't mean, being a lesser version of the man I'd like to be.

I'm starting to realize that long-term growth & happiness requires I get humbled daily. It never stops.
@kgo81 Lol. I'm trying to figure that out too, but it's already valued at zero.

I propose a new cryptocurrency: LexCoin. It is infinitely scarce, only zero available ever, but it does exist as a Platonic form. It can only be traded inside dreams. To mine it you must solve the hard problem of consciousness.
AI working from home. https://t.co/4EUUaRlf9T
Got to hang out and chat for a few hours with one of the greatest fighters in history, @GeorgesStPierre. Brilliant, kind, and dressed to kill. https://t.co/THbcYRVrzN

First contact with aliens outside of Earth will likely be by robots not humans.

So, we should probably teach our robots to make a good first impression.

@elonmusk Code executed successfully.

Computer awaiting further instructions.
Most people who suffer, suffer in silence.
Robot life goals. The "carry a big stick" test. https://t.co/FYFKsfW4XU

Reality is an illusion that exists only in your mind.

You are the only conscious being here.

The rest of us are NPCs that you imagined.

Happy April 1.

Here's my conversation with Nic Carter (@nic__carter) about Bitcoin core values, layered scaling, blocksize debates, and the future of decentralized finance.  https://t.co/LYLmiDmv0z https://t.co/DiF0nWRFLe
@elonmusk Plus, since I'm moving to Austin, you can hang out with me, which come to think of it, might be a negative.

Neurons in a culture dish trying to form connections with each other. Sped up to show 8 hours in 1 second. Bright spots are the neuron nuclei. We have 100 billion of these in our brain. Amazing. https://t.co/0VFHVQ1bpC

Great design and engineering is about love.

Every time I hear Jony Ive speak, I can't help but smile.

Great time hanging out with @joerogan for the @flograppling event in Austin with Gordon Ryan, John Danaher & others and then talking about jiu jitsu and life over burgers.

Thanks to Hywel Teague (pictured) for the great commentary and @mikecalimbas & @richard_immel for the pic. https://t.co/uTdcAl1lko

Here's my conversation with Ryan Schiller, creator of Librex, which is a new, quickly growing, anonymous discussion platform for college communities (now including MIT). We talk about the need & importance of the free exchange of ideas on college campuses. https://t.co/D5Nw6eSrKl https://t.co/pk3ka9w9Nb
My neural net needs an upgrade. https://t.co/0aPnWqa92Y
I appreciate it when my ego gets knocked down a notch by friends and strangers. It hurts in the short-term, but leads to growth in the long-term.
"If freedom of speech is taken away, then dumb and silent we may be led, like sheep to the slaughter." - George Washington, March 15, 1783
Don't be evil.
One day a human child born on a distant planet will have to be taught about a place called Earth from where humankind originated.
"What matters most is how well you walk through the fire." - Charles Bukowski

RT @APompliano: Last week I flew to Boston and sat down with @lexfridman for 3 hours to talk about Bitcoin.

This may be my favorite conver…

Here's my conversation with Anthony Pompliano (@APompliano) about all things Bitcoin and decentralized finance, including the nature of time, freedom, meaning, and the power of memes, yes including Dogecoin and @elonmusk. https://t.co/thAaFrPnnk https://t.co/dTBQSqDY51
School should inspire not just educate.

HODL the wheel.
This hits too close to home... busy ≠ productive. https://t.co/98aOCoSNdK
"Speak softly and carry a big stick." - Teddy Roosevelt

To clarify the confusion: Yes, that's annual. It cost $447,000 PER YEAR to support one inmate in an NYC jail.

Problem:
1. Bureaucracy drives up cost and inefficiencies.
2. Prison industrial complex makes cost into a feature not a bug.

In 2020, it cost $447k to support 1 inmate in NYC jails. Up from $334k in 2019.

I heard @AndrewYang talk about this yesterday, checked the numbers & was shocked. Three conclusions:

1. Andrew knows the data.
2. He should be NYC mayor.
3. The prison industrial complex is real.

Doge is Satoshi Nakamoto.

Always has been.

Here's my conversation with Ronald Sullivan (@profronsullivan), Harvard law professor, who was a defense lawyer for Harvey Weinstein and Aaron Hernandez. We talk about the ideal of justice in the face of controversy and evil. https://t.co/uglFgJiE9w https://t.co/OdptGy7G6w
"Freedom is not worth having if it does not include the freedom to make mistakes." - Gandhi

Here's my conversation with Ryan Hall (@ryanhall5050​), his 2nd time on the podcast. We talk about creating the illusion of choice in the game of fighting and re-engineering the foundations of martial arts. https://t.co/1DYOXoD2gN https://t.co/O6xjP5kVRR
